mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\hat{H}_{0}=\hbar v_{F}\hat{p}_{x}\sigma_{x}+\hbar v_{F}\left(\hat{p}_{y}+A_{y%
}(x)\right)\sigma_{y}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">ℏ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>F</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><mi>x</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">ℏ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>F</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><mi>y</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><mrow><msub><mi>A</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: The two degrees of freedom in the matrix are the Dirac particles, described by $H_0$ given in \eqref{H0} with spinor wave functions $u_n(\mathbf{r})$, and Dirac holes, described by the Hamiltonian for holes, $-H_0$ with spinor wave functions $v_n(\mathbf{r})$. The form of the hole Hamiltonian follows from the fact that the hole partner for a particle in valley $\mathbf{K}$ is a conjugated particle at valley $-\mathbf{K}$ so that $H_0^{\mathrm{holes}} ( \mathbf{K}) = H_0^*(-\mathbf{K}) = -H_0(\mathbf{K})$. Below we suppress the subvalley indices and consider only $\mathbf{K}$ subvalley except when otherwise mentioned. The coupling between the particles and holes is described by a superconducting order parameter, $\Delta(x)$, which, because of the periodic potential in the Hamiltonian, has a periodic dependence on the $x$ coordinate. It can be found by solving the self-consistency equation
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{pmatrix}H_{0}&\Delta(x)\\
\Delta^{*}(x)&-H_{0}\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}u_{n}(\mathbf{r})\\
v_{n}(\mathbf{r})\end{pmatrix}=E_{n}\begin{pmatrix}u_{n}(\mathbf{r})\\
v_{n}(\mathbf{r})\end{pmatrix}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>*</mo></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐫</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐫</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐫</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐫</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: The two degrees of freedom in the matrix are the Dirac particles, described by $H_0$ given in \eqref{H0} with spinor wave functions $u_n(\mathbf{r})$, and Dirac holes, described by the Hamiltonian for holes, $-H_0$ with spinor wave functions $v_n(\mathbf{r})$. The form of the hole Hamiltonian follows from the fact that the hole partner for a particle in valley $\mathbf{K}$ is a conjugated particle at valley $-\mathbf{K}$ so that $H_0^{\mathrm{holes}} ( \mathbf{K}) = H_0^*(-\mathbf{K}) = -H_0(\mathbf{K})$. Below we suppress the subvalley indices and consider only $\mathbf{K}$ subvalley except when otherwise mentioned. The coupling between the particles and holes is described by a superconducting order parameter, $\Delta(x)$, which, because of the periodic potential in the Hamiltonian, has a periodic dependence on the $x$ coordinate. It can be found by solving the self-consistency equation
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\begin{split}\displaystyle\Delta(x)=&\displaystyle\frac{gL^{2}}{4\pi^{2}}\int_%
{0}^{2\pi/L}dp_{x}\int_{0}^{p_{c}}dp_{y}\sum_{i}\sum_{n}\\
&\displaystyle\times v_{i,n,\mathbf{p}}^{*}(x)u_{i,n\mathbf{p}}(x)\tanh\left[%
\frac{E_{n}({\mathbf{p}})}{2k_{B}T}\right],\end{split}" display="block"><mtable columnspacing="0pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi/></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><msub><mi>p</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mn>0</mn><msub><mi>p</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><msub><mi>p</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mi>i</mi></munder><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mi>n</mi></munder></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd/><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mi/><mo>×</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>𝐩</mi></mrow><mo>*</mo></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>u</mi><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>𝐩</mi></mrow></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>tanh</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐩</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>T</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>
